response_text:
<![CDATA[CBC | Politics News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/politics/?cmp=rss en-ca Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:46:55 EST CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Trudeau, with family in tow, visits India's famed Taj Mahal]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-state-visit-india-1.4541128?cmp=rss 1.4541128 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:46:55 EST The Canadian Press News/Politics

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his family took a tour of the famed Taj Mahal and visited an elephant-rescue sanctuary north of Agra, on the first full day of a week-long visit to India.

]]> <![CDATA[Jagmeet Singh doesn't want to be timid, but it's still not clear how bold he will be]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/jagmeet-singh-ndp-convention-analysis-wherry-1.4540911?cmp=rss 1.4540911 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Aaron Wherry News/Politics

With delegates to the NDP policy convention cheering for the promise of proportional representation, Jagmeet Singh declared that "the time to be timid was over" and then he spoke of "courage." But the extent of Singh's courageousness is still taking shape.

]]> <![CDATA[Helping Haiti: Bibeau begins 3-day visit focused on improving health, empowering women ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/haiti-bibeau-health-women-1.4539678?cmp=rss 1.4539678 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Kathleen Harris News/Politics

International Development Minister Marie-Claude Bibeau is travelling to Haiti today to begin a three-day trip focusing on improving health and empowering women in the disaster-plagued, impoverished nation.

]]> <![CDATA[Singh gets 91% support in 1st NDP leadership review]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/jagmeet-singh-convention-ndp-speech-1.4540597?cmp=rss 1.4540597 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 11:50:04 EST CBC News News/Politics

Federal NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh's first leadership review vote ended positively, with 90.7 per cent of delegates at the convention in Ottawa voting against holding another leadership race.

]]> <![CDATA[Trudeau's India mission mixes global business with local politics]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-india-trade-trip-1.4540238?cmp=rss 1.4540238 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Evan Dyer News/Politics

Two-way trade between Canada and India amounts to only about $8 billion annually — a number Prime Minister Justin Trudeau hopes to improve with an official visit that begins this weekend. He has multiple meetings planned with Indian CEOs and business leaders over the coming days.

]]> <![CDATA[Support pours in after former MP Paul Dewar diagnosed with brain tumour]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/ottawa/paul-dewar-cancer-1.4540578?cmp=rss 1.4540578 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 10:18:23 EST CBC News News/Canada/Ottawa

Former Ottawa Centre MP Paul Dewar is currently undergoing treatment for brain cancer, according to his Facebook page.

]]> <![CDATA[Jagmeet Singh not picking sides in pipeline battle]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/singh-pipeline-bc-alberta-trans-mountain-1.4540543?cmp=rss 1.4540543 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 09:49:17 EST Elise von Scheel News/Politics

Federal NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh is refusing to take sides in the British Columbia-Alberta pipeline, as his party holds a convention where environmental policy resolutions are set to take up a large amount of real estate.

]]> <![CDATA[The NDP tries to catch up with the #MeToo era]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/ndp-harassment-metoo-analysis-wherry-1.4538763?cmp=rss 1.4538763 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 18:54:15 EST Aaron Wherry News/Politics

The federal NDP released a draft of its new harassment policy to party members at its policy convention on Friday, not long after the eruption of harassment allegations within its own ranks. But for the NDP — as for all political parties — coming up with the right process is only half the job.

]]> <![CDATA[Patrick Brown registers to run in PC leadership race]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/brown-enters-leadership-race-1.4539276?cmp=rss 1.4539276 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:06:34 EST CBC News News/Canada/Toronto

Patrick Brown has entered the race for leader of the Ontario Progressive Conservatives, just weeks after resigning from the position due to allegations of sexual misconduct.

]]> <![CDATA[NDP president offers apology for party's handling of harassment allegations]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/ndp-policy-convention-1.4538953?cmp=rss 1.4538953 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:26:13 EST CBC News News/Politics

The NDP policy convention kicked Friday in Ottawa, with several topics on the agenda.

]]> <![CDATA[Canada imposes sanctions on Myanmar general over Rohingya abuses]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/myanmar-general-sanctions-canada-1.4539003?cmp=rss 1.4539003 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 13:43:32 EST Levon Sevunts News/Politics

The federal government has imposed sanctions against a high-ranking member of the Myanmar military under Canada's new foreign human rights legislation, Foreign Affairs Minister Chrystia Freeland announced Friday.

]]> <![CDATA[Canada won't be 'impulsive' responding to U.S. tax cuts, Morneau says]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/morneau-economists-budget-1.4539429?cmp=rss 1.4539429 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:04:23 EST The Canadian Press News/Business

The Liberal government will not 'act in an impulsive way' in response to U.S. corporate tax cuts that economists say pose a threat to Canada's competitiveness, the federal finance minister said after a pre-budget meeting Friday.

]]> <![CDATA[Liberals write off $200M in student loans feds will never collect]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/student-loans-write-off-1.4539426?cmp=rss 1.4539426 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:56:33 EST The Canadian Press News/Politics

The federal government is writing off more than $200 million in outstanding student loan payments that officials will never be able to collect.

]]> <![CDATA[Lynn Beyak 'inflamed attitudes against Indigenous citizens': Manitoba senator]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/lynn-beyak-mary-mccallum-residential-schools-1.4538708?cmp=rss 1.4538708 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 15:34:18 EST CBC News News/Canada/Manitoba

The senator from Barren Lands First Nation, Man., is taking Ontario colleague Lynn Beyak to task over her controversial defence of Canada's residential school system, and her refusal to strip letters supporting that stance from her Senate website.

]]> <![CDATA[Trudeau won't meet with Indian leader behind Sikh separatist controversy]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-india-sikh-singh-1.4538164?cmp=rss 1.4538164 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 20:26:46 EST Mia Rabson News/Politics

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will not meet with the Indian politician who has publicly accused members of Trudeau's cabinet of being connected to the Sikh separatist movement.

]]> <![CDATA[Senate deal on cannabis bill timeline means no sales before August]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/senate-vote-pot-bill-1.4537624?cmp=rss 1.4537624 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 16:11:24 EST John Paul Tasker News/Politics

Leaders in the Senate have reached a deal on a timeline for the legalization of cannabis — a schedule that pushes the start of retail sales past July 1, the date that had been floated in the past as the government's target.

]]> <![CDATA[After next month's TPP signing, Canada to open free trade talks with Mercosur bloc]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/canada-mercosur-free-trade-talks-1.4537338?cmp=rss 1.4537338 Thu, 15 Feb 2018 17:00:00 EST Evan Dyer News/Politics

Barring last-minute obstacles, Canadian negotiators plan to meet their Mercosur counterparts for talks in Asuncion, Paraguay, one day after trade minister Francois-Philippe Champagne signs the CPTPP in Santiago de Chile.

]]> <![CDATA[Garneau orders officials to explore all options for reducing laser incidents involving planes]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/garneau-plane-lasers-1.4538520?cmp=rss 1.4538520 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 08:26:15 EST Joan Bryden News/Politics

Transport Minister Marc Garneau has instructed his officials to explore "all possible options" to crack down on the dangerous practice of aiming laser pointers at aircraft.

]]> <![CDATA[Ex-leader Patrick Brown expelled from Ontario PC caucus ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/patrick-brown-pc-caucus-1.4538874?cmp=rss 1.4538874 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 11:33:53 EST Amara McLaughlin News/Canada/Toronto

Patrick Brown, who resigned as leader amid accusations of sexual misconduct, has been expelled from Ontario's Progressive Conservative caucus just days before legislature is set to resume.

]]> <![CDATA[Men-only RCMP Facebook group crosses line of conduct, say female RCMP members]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/men-only-rcmp-facebook-group-crosses-line-of-conduct-say-female-rcmp-members-1.4533910?cmp=rss 1.4533910 Wed, 14 Feb 2018 17:06:47 EST Manjula Dufresne News/Canada/British Columbia

Female RCMP members say a secret Facebook group restricted to male RCMP members reinforces the boys' club nature of the force at a time when it is facing harassment lawsuits.

]]>
